pros: Great group of talented healthcare professionals.

job_title: Certified Pharmacy Technician in New York, NY
pros: For the most part staff is friendlier than other hospitals I’ve worked for which goes a long way in these stressful times in healthcare. The facility itself is fairly updated and kept clean. I work evenings and often pick up midnight shifts, I appreciate that the cafe is open 24/7 (I’m sure the parents do as well). I appreciate that we have a designated parking garage (Other hospitals I’ve worked for did not).
cons: Our insurance plan is terrible in comparison to other jobs I’ve worked at. In particular, mental health should be something they have better coverage for considering how much they talk about how “important” it is to take care of our mental health. My previous hospital had a $15 copay for therapy, rn my copay is about $115. Same with medications. It’s very frustrating. Working in healthcare you would expect to have decent health coverage. (Mind you I’m paying more for my benefits than I was at my previous employer).

pros: Working with children is a rewarding experience. The majority of employees deeply care for children's well being and outcomes, Most people are able to work in a team environment.
cons: Management is worried about the bottom dollar - to a fault. Will change schedules for patients last minute to pull a provider from clinic to go do something that makes more money (OR), which is not great for patient care or rapport. All managers are great at telling employees one thing to their face, but doing nothing, blaming it on "budget" or "upper management." Work schedules are not family friendly. Nemours will NOT let providers go part-time as "it costs the same administratively to have PT vs FT providers," and they are worried most about billable income only. Any changes are incredibly slow, and usually not in the employees favor (read: they will say its for the employee but will only change anything if its advantageous for the company financially, and ultimately will not be great for the long run). And the company culture - puts up a good front on paper, but is highly negative and cliquey. You're either in the club - or you are very, very out (especially if you're too verbal and bring things to HR). Unfortunately, I have had my fair share of racist and misogynistic encounters on all levels while working here.

pros: great mission, great people to work with

job_title: Access Center Associate in Wilmington, DE
pros: Nothing I have nothing positive to say about this company
cons: The management was not transparent about the position and requirements. I was told I would schedule for three departments and instead it was six. I was essentially scared into doing more work than what was required. I was scolded as if I was a child and the person was completely wrong and didn’t even apologize when I called her out on it. The salary does not match the job requirements. And not to mention the parents are rude! And there is no back up from managers. I am a hard worker but I’m not a slave. Having a bachelors degree in health care administration helps me to view the work place way different.

review_title: Great for experience, not so great for career advancement
pros: Culture that promotes innovation. Gain experience in various facets of IS
cons: Promotions to Analyst level are achievable, but promotions to Senior level are biased and based on who you know. Process is not transparent and eligibility criteria is subjective

review_title: Gone downhill since current CEO took over
pros: Nice coworkers, flex schedule, work from home option for some.
cons: Forced Covid and flu vax on work from home employees. Did not respect religious exemptions. Fired employees who refused, even though those same employees worked through the pandemic. CEO is self serving and has made the mission of the company all about MONEY and less about the children. CEO is a woke follower full of virtue signaling. Company decided to spend millions on rebranding in the middle of the pandemic, but told employees they didn’t have enough money to give us raises. Pay is way below par, below industry standards, new hires paid more than existing employees doing the same job, no cost of living increase in over a decade, no bonuses, benefits are basic and insurance is poor with high deductible plans only offered, got rid of their Bridge plan for children, company won’t provide office supplies, training is poor, management is heavy, company wont replace certain positions so pile extra work on existing employees without paying us more.

review_title: Good place to work and gain experience; don't spend your whole career here unless money is a non-issue
pros: Love the campus, atmosphere and most other associates I've encountered. It's a small enough hospital where you recognize familiar faces around a beautiful campus. Free parking is huge if you've worked in any Philly hospitals. PTO is great
cons: Compensation for patient facing associates. Nemours is so administratively top-heavy that the people at the bottom aren't paid fairly. This leads to high turnover and burnout of lower level employees. Cut some of the administrative hierarchy out, and pay the people who directly care for and work with the patients better. Benefits are meh aside from PTO. My overall complaint is the mediocre salary ladder. You have to pay good people to retain them. 3% raises don't even keep up with annual inflation in today's age.

pros: You can learn a lot here, and the benefits are decent but expensive. The remote work is well handled. Onboarding and training are well structured.
cons: In I.T. there is no career path set for advancement or differentiation between Level 1 and Level 3 support; admins do it all, from entry-level data center work on up to engineer level. Expect a lot of after hours work and weekends. Pay is low for the market.

The organization and most departments are dedicated to the wellbeing of all children that enter our facilities.

cons: Steer clear of positions that report to a continuous improvement, transformation office or project management area unless you enjoy being controlled, monitored or discouraged from obtaining new skills that are offered internally at no cost.

pros: Working with kids. Health benefits are awesome
cons: Management is a hot mess very unorganized. Lots of people on cell phones playing games, shopping, social media, planning wedding all while on the clock at work and all while families are waiting past their appointment times to be seen. The department chief has no idea what goes on in the department, the staff that she thinks is great are the laziest workers. The hardest workers she thinks don't know how to do their jobs. They have lost a lot of staff the past few years because of this. I would never take my own kids there just because I know what an unorganized mess the place is and I have better things to do with my time then wait on staff that would rather sit and gossip and play on their phones then do their jobs.

pros:
Pay is acceptable 
Schedule is flexible
Exceptional PTO accruals
cons:
No loyalty to employees that have dedicated years to the company. They will hire externally any chance they get. 
Only some managers are transparent on payscales for your current position. Some pretend not to know.
They were initially going to cover all COViD related expenses and add a COVID rider on our insurance and then backed out. 
They didn't give anyone a raise although they laid off so many people. 
Most people that we're laid off were POC
It's the most punitive and judgemental employer I ever worked for. 
They have "values" you are supposed to follow but management doesn't follow them.

review_title: Still the best job I've ever had

I'm also grateful for the many learning opportunities I've had so far, as well as the encouragement to do so. And even during many challenges in the past year, I've enjoyed a good work-life balance.
cons: The Agile process of work scheduling continues to sometimes be a hindrance to daily work, where more attention seems to be to satisfy the requirements of Agile, rather than have Agile facilitate the work.

job_title: Patient Care Technician in Orlando, FL
pros: The people are awesome. Great management

pros: Actually a great place to work - all depends on the department you are in.  Great benefits if you have children.
cons: We lose great people due to salary disparities for same positions.  If you are already in the position you are paid below or at the lower end of the scale.  If a need arises to hire for same position externally, the salaries offered are 20-30% higher.  Now you work with people doing the same work you do but at a much higher rate.  HR is aware and seems comfortable with this.  Internally and consistently, those in the "clique" are promoted and move up together, which adds to the low morale for those who do the work to make them look good.  Justify why your work should speak volumes for a more inline salary and always hear "there's no monies in the budget".  But there's always money in the budget to award double digit bumps throughout the year for favorites.  PRAYING our new leader and Board will change this practice.

review_title: Horrible work place managers are clueless
pros: Good vacation time and breaks that’s it
cons: Management is horrible and clueless to workers

job_title: Patient Service Specialist in Jacksonville, FL
pros: Daily work schedule; Awesome benefits
cons: Pay raises are minimum; When short-staffed, multiple job duties fall to one person

pros: Great work life balance and benefits.
cons: There were not any cons.

pros: I liked the benefits a lot
cons: The benefits could have been better

pros: The schedule is super busy
cons: It has great work environment

pros: I had a wonderful tenure at Nemours. I was employed for three years as an EA and was so fortunate to work with a great team. I was able to learn and grow. The culture is wonderful and it truly is all about the kids! I often wish I never left but it was time for me to move on to the next step in my career.  I would recommend Nemours to anyone looking for a great career.
cons:
My team and leaders were amazing. 
However, there was another team that I worked in concert with and the administrator has had many complaints and even legal action taken yet nothing occurred/changed. Administrator was left in the position followed by not one but two promotions. I witnessed associates have breakdowns, treated unfairly and very rudely by the administrator. High turnover in that area which is really sad because the organization seems to resolve other issues with the proper resolution. I ultimately chose to leave in part due to the way she spoke to me in front of my colleagues in a very unprofessional manner as well as moving on in my career.

job_title: Systems Analyst in Orange Park, FL
pros: Great Health Care for Employees
cons: Team structure changes every year

pros: good is good is good is
cons: there is not enough food in

pros: Love working here- great coworkers
cons: There is a high turnover

pros: Not a bad location in north Delaware... one of the easiest commutes you'll find anywhere.. it's great working towards solutions to help children
cons: where to begin... management is rife with 9 to 5 (with most disappearing at 4:30 or earlier) paycheck collectors... who talk a good talk, but only real drive seems to be maintaining the status quo and keeping their job as simple and carefree as possible... meanwhile, the general staff is typically overloaded and understaffed and expected to go above and beyond... when staff leave or transfer out, that persons assignments are more typically just dumped on one of their coworkers, rather then hire to fill the vacancy... meanwhile, management seems to constantly be promoting and adding "assistants" to their ranks that do more to bottleneck functionality then add efficiency..

pros: Benefits- good insurance for children
cons: Only care about money. Not their staff

review_title: Nemours Children's Hospital - pretty building with ugly stories
pros: The benefits package and salaries are very good.  The training programs are computerized and organized electronically.
cons: It is well known that the organization lacks ethics.  Several managers have gotten their positions through questionable ways (friends, previous business deals, etc.), and they are inept, confused, and ineffective.  Some managers have unstable behaviors and completely get away with it.  Without supervisors who really manage and make plans, employees put up with managers' whims and last-minute requests constantly.  Doing the bare minimum and taking the easy way out is a lifestyle there.

review_title: Not the DuPont company it was, skip and go elsewhere unless you want to be underpaid and overworked.  Plenty of layoffs.
pros:
I would take my kids here.
They do care about your kids - its all about the kids.
Lots of jobs (sort of a pro but people don't stay very long because of work load)
cons:
Management is not hired for their skillset, its a good old boy network.
They lay off people all the time for "reduction in force", so not stable.
Very low chance of job advancement, unless you go elsewhere.
Its all about the kids, employees were told by our Orlando top senior leader that if we don't like our work load there are other hospitals in the area; while this is true, its an rude crush-morale attitude to have when all employees were stating was that their hours average 55+ hours a week (unpaid after 40 since we are salary) and we need more staff.

job_title: Executive Director Tech in Wilmington, DE
pros: You get to work with a wide variety of Children with various issues. Being a Level 1 trauma center and a Cardiac Center, I have been able to see a lot of things that I would have never seen in a regular Community hospital. I also feel as if they have good perks to working and generous time off, in addition to a really great shift differential. They also have you on only one shift, so there is no wondering if you will have to be day or night shift, nor do you have to constantly keep adjusting to the different shifts, and you can work the shift that works better for you.
cons: There are a few staff members who are always complaining, leading to others being turned off. We have had many people leave because of the constant complaints, thus leaving us really short staffed at times. Now that they have filled a lot of the positions, it is all new staff who are still not qualified to work certain positions.

pros: Opportunity to work in a children's medical facility.  We only work Monday thru Friday and have the major holidays paid off.  We do have a recognition program to recognize "Employees of the Month".  We also can give "Spot Light Awards" which is a gift certificate for $20 to a local restaurant with approval from department manager's approval.
cons: There's not alot of opportunity for advancement in some of the job titles.  Also, the person most qualified for a position is not always the person who gets promoted to a job.  Our sick time, personal leave and vacation time is separate, it would be better to allow a bank of all hours together to be used at the employee's discretion.  That way when people do not use sick leave they have the option to use that time for personal or vacation.

review_title: We put on a smile for the kids but employees are not treated well.
pros:
Helping children in the community
Nemours does spend allot of resources to have the best possible care for patients
I would take my kids here
cons:
Management needs to use the standards of behavior and look in mirror, be accountable!  
Raises are to be based on performance management but in reality the manager for department has a set amount to money to hand out, so its not really based on performance.
Conflict of interest with Directors and managers holding personal relationships outside of work with employees and letting that affect the workplace.

review_title: Overall, this is a good employer that does amazing things to improve the quality of life for children.
job_title: Medical Secretary IV in Jacksonville, FL
pros: Great benefits, competetive pay, and really great people.  The physicians genuinely care about their patients, but management is so busy playing the numbers game that they often lose sight of the mission.
cons: Some of the Executive Managment/Administrative team have their favorites, and those are the people who do well.  Unless you are well liked by those specific people, you may have a difficult time getting opportunities for advancement or recognition for work done.

pros: Altruistic purpose affects attitudes towards employees and their importance. Corporations may say similar words but those corporations do not mean it. Nemours does. Benefits are comparable to health care companies (good) not corporations. Salaries are reasonable for a non-profit (slightly less than for profit). Hours are reasonable (45 for full time) and very considerate of work/life balance. Expectations are realistic and an appropriate amount of time is given to meet deadlines. Attitudes are pretty good. My observation is that people who grumble here have not worked for a for profit corporation and do not realize how good they have it. Coworkers are good. Management is reasonable (most of them).
cons: Workspace is a little less than ideal. Too many cubicals leads to some distractions. But I have had worse elsewhere

pros: Taking care of amazing children and their family.
cons: Management for Nursing is horrible. I would not know the CNE if I fell over her. Magnet is a joke, nursing has no say in CI activities; decisions appear to be made by management and physicians prior to "introducing" these ideas to nursing. Nurses are treated like garbage and there is constant interruptions to "help" doctors, PT, pharmacy and anyone else who happens along whenever they have time, screw the nurse if it is a bad time for them because it is not about nursing at all. All changes are forced on nursing and tgey have no say in any changes. Some departments have no nurse to nurse handout because doctors or whover don't want to wait for "nursing."  Nursing the hospital scapegoat. If you are a nurse avoid this place at all costs. They really need a union.

review_title: Could be a great place to work, but ...
pros: The staff are amazing.  Some of the most committed and dedicated nurses I have ever had the privilege of working alongside.  The interprofessional relationships are stellar as well - the doctors actually seek out the opinions and information from the nurses, and listen to our concerns.
cons: Management is a shambles.  The interim director of the ICU engages in emotional and mental harassment of nurses.  The CNO verbally berates other nurses over the telephone in a teleconference where everyone can hear.  Staffing patterns are often poorly thought out, and occasionally unsafe.

pros: Get to help children in need. Many of the medical staff and clinicians are very professionals and truly care for the well care of their patients.
cons: Administration does not follow the organization's own policies. Leadership is based on friendship and not on talent and experience. Many of the managers and directors obtained their positions without any previous administrative experience and are making many mistake within their departments. The culture and values that the administration mentions during the new employee orientation is not reinforced and there are not consequences for not following rules. Staff in some departments are incompetent on their fields resulting on many patients stopping their care at the hospital and going to other local hospitals. Senior management is untrustworthy.

review_title: Most amazing experience of my career
pros: Incredible facility, people, and experience.  Truly innovative and vision of creating a culture of family centered care with the highest quality standards. This is the first greenfield hospital built in this country in over 35 YEARS.  Incredible to be part of such an effort - it can be frustrating building something so complex from the ground up, and it requires vision and commitment to fulfilling the mission.
cons: Stabilization of patient volume and referrals can be stressful.  The hospital is still very much in start up mode, but not surprising due to the complexity of what is being accomplished.

review_title: Great Company, great mission, but state lines are challenging
pros: The people that work for Nemours truly care, the mission is wonderful and overall the work life balance is very good. The benefits are great and the bridge to health future for children is a huge plus for anyone with children
cons: Nemours struggles with leadership spanning state lines, it is felt that the business and decisions are made out of the non-clinical home office in Jacksonville Florida. Most leaders in Jacksonville are seasoned experts, but rarely are seen in public around the Delaware sites. Job movement is tough as well with so many middle managers waiting to retire due to their pensions,  making it challenging to move up the chain

pros: There are so many resources available to help you be successful at your job. We have a wonderful child life staff that helps to ease anxiety of illness and procedures. We also have IV teams and specialty nurses that are able to provide additional assistance to meet  individual patients needs.
cons: Administration only looks at the big picture and do not care about individual accomplishments or successes.  They are strict and only follow preset universal policy without any exceptions to the rules.

review_title: Whatever good we give out, comes back to us.
pros: The children and familes to whom we provide service is first.  The working environment is excellent with superior leadersihp, Our work-life balance is incredible as well as benefits.  Never have I worked anywhere that I felft like I could make a difference not only in my  life but in the lives of others until I came to work at Nemours.
cons: Financial restraints do not allow us to reach all those in need.  Heatlhcare in general has gotten so much attention; yet we have yet to be able to cover the care of all our people especially those most vulnerable, the children.

job_title: Patient Care Technician in Orlando, FL
pros: They genuinely care for their employees. The pay is above average for the location. They provide food and many fun events for employees. This health system truly cares about the overall well being of their employees while providing a fun environment to work in. They love to recognize job well done and give their employees to recognize each other as well. I love working here.
cons: The new system required for updating throughout the year using performance management makes it difficult for yearly bonuses or raises if one forgets to do them. The employees need to stay on top of it to receive the highest amount of raise offered.

pros: Helping children, even indirectly, is a worthy cause.  That is what keeps me coming to work.  The people that I work directly with are a fantastic and dedicated group of people.
cons: The management here needs to get its act together.  And as an organization, we need to stop being so top heavy.  Way too many chiefs, not nearly enough indians.

review_title: Life is too short to work at Nemours Ophthalmology
pros: Working with children. Good benefits for employees with children
cons:
There is rampant unfairness in the ophthalmology clinic. 
There are techs who work hard and then there are a couple of techs who spend a good deal of time on the internet or reading while the other techs take care of patients. No one holds the lazy techs accountable for fear of being fired.

pros: Almost every thing I've encountered has been a positive experience. The 2-day employee orientation was inspiring and fun. Here is a chance to be a part of something bigger. Personally, just the opportunity to do some real work in my field again was enough. The atmosphere that is promoted is positive and encouraging. No place is perfect, but the core intent Nemours has is to strive for perfection in matters that are important for customers, as well as for employees. Now, where I came from before was a far cry from this environment, so here I found much greener grass. And....I've only been here for a month. Having said that, you may take my review with that grain of salt. It may not be for everyone (hospitals and other health systems are unique environments to work in) and there may be better places, depending on your point of view. However, for me, having a manager and a team that cares about each other, as much as they care about the "customers" (whoever at the moment that may be) is one of the most important aspects of employment I've been looking for again (and I know what it's been like to lose a good team). Beyond that, there are many other pros, like good benefits and other such basics of employment; though to me they are just icing on top. I plan to fully enjoy my time at Nemours and grow and improve as much as I can.
cons: More of a bit of advice than a con: If you want to be a part of something positive and bigger than yourself, such as Nemours, you should check baggage (ex. ego, attitude, etc) at the door and make an effort to excel in many ways, both professionally and personally. This is a good thing, as being a better you helps foster a better employment environment, which helps you be a better you, which helps.....and so on. Like a good marriage, it requires work, but it is worth it.

review_title: Has the potential to be great, but executive management is trying to reinvent the wheel for no reason
pros: Great pay, great floor staff (usually).  Benefits are really competitive as well.
cons: 0 sense of balancing what a particular floor can effectively staff based on how many nurses available during the day or night.  Management levels above the floor manager are aloof and oblivious to the needs of nursing and support staff.

review_title: Not the greatest place. But better than some.
job_title: Materials Management Technician/Whatever They Want You to BE in Orlando, FL
pros: Great benefit packet. Great time off.
cons:
There are more managers than leaders.
Very misleading in interview, sign up for one thing end up doing something totally different.
High turnover rate.
Organization is top-heavy, failing to realize the small people that help move the hospital.

pros: Good mission and values put into practice. Genuine caring. Trust in and respect for employees. In my dept they walk the talk when it comes to engaging employees and all levels of staff can be honest with no retaliation (but that might be the personality of our group leader, an intelligent self confident woman who just retired).
cons: Over reliance on trendy business practices that don’t always fit w/real life work.

job_title: Pre Certification Specialist in Orlando, FL
pros: coworkers, it's a job, a lot of food, the hospital is gorgeous.
cons: management, low morale, unrealistic productivity goals.

pros: There is great flexibility in work scheduling available to associates, and the pay is good for your experience level.  There are many opportunities to work extra hours based on hospital-wide need.
cons: Sometimes difficult personalities make the job a little harder, but that is the case wherever one may go.  Sometimes it is difficult to take vacation when you want to, based on availability.

review_title: Deep pockets, AI DuPont's 4 billion trust fund is the foundation that fills the gaps.
pros:
Alfred DuPont's legacy is alive to an extent. Strong presence in Delaware.
Orthopedics speciality strengths in Delaware. Alfred's trust fund.
cons: Too many chief's/management. No DuPont family in the board or management. Resources stretched thin due to lack of strategy in expansion in DE, PA and FL. Investing close to $500 million in 2013 during an economic downturn and pressure to reduce costs. Employee engagement is stagnant.

review_title: The people are wonderful and it is a great foundation to work for. The benefits are amazing!
pros: The people are wonderful and it is a great foundation to work for. The benefits are amazing. Your children's benefits are covered at 100% by Nemours including their visits, medicine, and premiums.
cons: Working with sick children can be difficult. A lot of the children have debilitating diseases or cancer and it can get to you. It's easy to become attached to patients that are sick.

pros: Good salary and benefits.  Better than average time off for new employees.
cons: Nurse on nurse bullying and incivility are ignored. Management is more concerned with being part of the group than promoting a team environment, willing to sacrifice the nurse bullied and allowing impunity even when physical violence is threatened.  The bullied nurse is therefore further isolated and victimized.

pros: Pay is above average..but must be weighed against the frustrations you must endure.
cons: Pharmacy management is made up of totally inexperienced managers.  They are out of touch with their workforce or they do not care to engage with them.  The company does not understand that just because you are a mediocre pharmacist, does not mean you will make a good manager.  Poor decision making has hurt several employees and management is oblivious to it.

pros: Free coffee, high wages, safe neighborhood location, on-site fitness center, and Zumba classes make it attractive to potential employees.
cons: Departmental leadership abuses, communication gaps between management and staff, low morale, fear of retaliation, fear consequences of minor errors, inadequate training.

pros: Great benefits. If you have kids and a big family. Your work have a possibility to be meaningful to your community and further.
cons: Poor management in most departments. Good performance is not rewarded, only seniority. Never enough space, supplies, or support to do a good job.

pros: good pay and benefits, beautiful hospital
cons: Bullying, back stabbing, trying to get people fired and that is the nurse managers and administrators.   Original employees in Orlando were very territorial, Don't practice own standards of behavior.   Trying to make any changes or improvement took to long or never happened.  Non-medical employees effecting medical policies.

review_title: It is a wonderful place to work. Very caring atmosphere.
pros: The caring atmosphere and love of Children is wonderful there. Love it. I can't say enough about Nemour's.
cons: I travel quite a bit to get to work and back and would like to to work from home and this was offered but later postponed for some and not for others. So my hopes for  remote coding working have become unsure. I would rather stay with Nemours but will see what happens.

pros: They do amazing work!  Changing the lives of children everyday.  They provide wonderful Standards of Behavior and during orientation, you are ready to tackle the world
cons: They choose management over employees and physicians time and time again.  Physicians have no say in what they have, and really, neither do employees.  They do NOT live up to their own Standards of Behavior

job_title: Certified Medical Assistant in Orlando, FL
pros: Good benefits. Most of the doctors are great.
cons: No room to grow. Nemours uses  Red tape policy. Don't dare to  complaint or fight for your rights cause your are going to be out of the door in a heart beat. Management have a clique on which they protects each other backs even if they're wrong. Very traumatic experience working with this company. unethical.

job_title: Athletic Trainer in Bryn Mawr, PA
pros: I had a great experience at Nemours. It was a big corporate company, but very well run. Everyone I worked with was so nice and it was a great team atmosphere.
cons: The management was not always on top of things. They let a lot of things slide and didn't actually care what was happening with their employees.

review_title: It's a good place to work.
job_title: Research Associate II in Wilmington, DE
pros: It's a really good children's hospital. Parents really know that the doctors and nurses care about their children. I feel that I'm making a difference in children's lives.
cons: The rigid pay scale and lack of funding for research means that I need to look elsewhere for a job, unfortunately. The red tape and "Performance Management" hoops to jump through are really annoying.

review_title: Proud to say I worked here.
pros: Mission driven organization with heart behind every local decision made. I was always proud to tell people I worked here, and I was proud to go to work each day, knowing that miracles were happening each day for families.
cons: With corporate headquarters in Florida, the disconnect was often apparent in Delaware and many decisions that directly impacted hospital unit staff weren't communicated effectively. Felt disjointed at times.

pros: Benevolent, altruistic provider of healthcare for children.  Excellent in caring.
cons: Typical bureaucratic top heavy organization.  More diverse in gender particularly than most, ( which some may feel is a good thing ), but then liberal minded and politically motivated upper management.  Apparently do not feel the rank and file have a voice, if so should not be heard.

pros: Good salary but not great. Clean modern campus. Benefits are pretty good. Good education for rns and ems staff. Good equipment.
cons: Favoritism. Retaliation if you voice a problem. Very feminized culture. Lots of gossip. Extreme micromanagement. If you don't fit in the clique the force you out one way or another.

pros: Smartest, most passionate people I have ever worked among.
cons: Being new, we still have much to overcome and learn!

pros: Nemours is a wonderful place to work, the staff caters to their patients and families.  I enjoy the people I work with, I have learned a great deal from working with great talent.
cons: This is a very competitive environment. You will have to bring your A++ game if you want to stand out. Great talent everywhere.  Good for the hospital.

job_title: Staff RN, Nurse Educator in Wilmington, DE
pros: The institution wants to make it work for all concerned, the parents, patients, and employees.
cons: As with all big institutions, the bigger you get the further away top management gets to the "real worker." The bigger AIDHC has gotten the less personal it has become. : (

review_title: Nice people - couldn't care less about research
job_title: Postdoctoral Research Associate in Wilmington, DE
pros: Everyone I came in contact here was very nice on a personal level. There was a lot of camaraderie. Children's health insurance was awesome... free coverage (at 100%, I think) for as long as you work there)
cons: The 'big wigs' and the administrators didn't really care about research and it showed int he salary.

job_title: Revenue Cycle Analyst in Wilmington, DE
pros: The mission of Alfred I duPont and how competent, compassionate, smart people carry out that mission every day. Regardless of your role at Nemours we are all there to serve the needs of our patients and families every day.
cons: There are times and projects where it feels that there are enough people to do as good a job as we'd like.

pros:
Physicians are doing wonderful things for children.
Convenient locations.
Information systems are current.
cons:
Physicians and accountants are not inherenctly good managers, but they run the show here. 
Like many, they survive despite their good fortune.

review_title: Love working with the kids but there is favoritism and retaliation within management
pros:
Children are wonderful to work with .
Learned a lot there.
have some really great co workers
flexible schedule
decent pay
cons: Very expensive benefits. No support from Management. High turnover. Very negative environment in which to work. Hire Managers that arent qualified and dont have degrees. Favortism between management  and employees runs rampant. Too many managers, not enough nursing staff

pros: Never been treated better. From daily interactions to benefits even "lower level" employees are valued. They don't just talk the talk, but also walk the walk.
cons: High level of care means a lot is expected of you. No slacking off or poor work is appropriate. They hire the best and expect you to live up to those standards.

review_title: Corporate Services is getting top heavy - Agile/Sprinting is not what it seems
pros: Health benefits for family are hard to beat. Work from home time is generous depending on your team.
cons: Some benefits are being taken away, making this just another place to work, versus a great place to work. Process driven, not people driven. No accountability or communication.

pros: Great co-workers and rewarding working with kids.
cons: Management is heavy and will bully employees it doesn't like.  Management is very clicky and will ignore problems with employees if it is one of their pets.

review_title: I am proud to work for Nemours!
pros:
A nonprofit organization totally committed to the well being and improved health of children.
Nemours also places a high value on it's associates and their individual contribution to the hospitals mission.  Nemours has an excellent reputation in the area and the country
cons: It's difficult for nurses to "get in" and get hired

pros: Good money. Awesome working with the kids. The staff was pretty fun and the hospital was really nice.
cons: Awful management with no backbone. They did not have the employees back on issues and sided with the upper management over things that should have been resolved within the department.

pros: amazing mission helping children and families from around the world, which clears away much of the difficult stuff
cons: Lots of layers of management makes it tough to get work done.  The management really needs to find its path

pros: Coworkers are like family, awesome technology, great pay!
cons: Acuity not consistent, always adding more charting, required surveys of each other, leaving less time to spend with patients.

pros: The experience for your next career
cons: The IT department is full of micro managers.  You are required to give daily updates on every waking moment of your day.  Look into the organizational chart, it’s full family members and best friends.  In addition, there is corruption going on from hiring from outside businesses owned by management.  There is too much middle management.

pros: Friendly atmosphere. Plenty of education opportunities.
cons: Benefits are not great. Payroll is hard to talk to.

review_title: Not for someone who is moving up in his/her career
pros: Has an enormous endowment that allows management and the board of directors to cover up a multitude of errors and misadventures..
cons: Management is "Command/Control". If you are a clinician or manager considering this organization, you would be best to take a step back. Senior management are afraid of losing their jobs and, as such, are very, very risk adverse.

review_title: Great place to work! Bring my kids there too
job_title: Child Life Specialist in Wilmington, DE
pros: First class care and continuous improvement to patient and family centered care. Free, easy parking
cons: Sometimes it's compared to another area children's hospital, however, it's very different with many positive attributes

pros: The commitment to the mission.
cons: The Good Old Boys Club is Alive and Well

pros: PAY and benefits are the only upside to working here.
cons: In experienced staffing, the standards of behavior are not practiced by management or doctors.

pros:
Flexible hours, 
Autonomous work environment
Salary above average
great hospital if you have children
cons:
Leadership challenges, depending on division
Hiring process may be up to three months

pros: None unless you are a family member of someone or if you are in good with someone in management
cons: Nemours only cares about hiring and promoting family And friends. Administration is oblivious to the terrible management team at the home office. They are running the company into the ground specifically the CBO and the CBO directors .Just terrible.

pros: Competitive salary based on experience. Fairly good nurse to patient ratios. Good use of mid-level practitioners.
cons: Highly political environment. Small staff means management from the top down plays favorites. They are a small hospital trying to practice as a large academic center. The educational support for nurses simply isn't there.

job_title: Windows Systems Administrator in Jacksonville, FL
pros: Great mission, benefits, non-profit, work at home, overall great place to work.
cons: As with any company managment depends on the manager but overall everyone is helpful and appreciated. Pay could be better for people who move up.

review_title: Not a bad place to work
pros: I have worked registration at other companies and this one is far more patient and understanding.
cons: They can implement silly work flows at times.

review_title: listen to your employees.  we make the difference
pros: health benefits for employees children
cons: micro-management from supervisors, managers do not enforce business compliance

job_title: Pediatric Nurse Practitioner in Jacksonville, FL
pros: Nice people, nice facilities, good online resources.
cons: Takes advantage of exempt status...40 hours per week is really 50 plus hours a week every week.  Little opportunity to advance.  No coverage for vacations etc.

job_title: Registered Nurse II in Jacksonville, FL
pros: Competitive pay; transparency between associates and management; warm and welcoming; every employee truly lives by the company standards.
cons: I’ve been an employee for 6 months and have really enjoyed every minute of my time with this company.

pros: Lots of positions to move into.
cons: Sometime can be based on favoritism

pros: Excellent Benefits, flexible schedule, PTO, fun atmosphere
cons: Management spread too thin, not able to be effective or support new employees when necessary.

job_title: Medical Billing Specialist in Jacksonville, FL
pros:
I work from home
the company is people-oriented  first and then money oriented
laid back and trusting
my team is not micro managed
cons:
sometimes on my team communication is not clear
some teams and job functions are micromanaged

pros: Nemours really cares about kids and is a wonderful place to work.
cons: Because it’s a large healthcare system, sometimes actions take longer than they need to.

pros: Best Doctors, excellent mission ..
cons: Culture can be challenging, hard to get approval and things done per all the red tape, limited opportunity for advancements, compensation is a bit low compared to market value.

pros: Working with children and their families is fun and rewarding.
cons: Changing schedules at the last minute.

pros: never denied time off, does not monitor breaks
cons: understaffed, manager an supervisor does not know or have what it takes to run a department

job_title: Department Supervisor in Wilmington Manor Gardens, DE
pros: Excellent group of physicians that take care of children
cons: To much business politics and favoritism

pros: Great work life balance. Growth opportunities. Director is hands on. Not a lot of turnover..
cons: To GET in a lot of who you know not what you know. Multiple interview levels.

pros: -High salary in the central Florida area
cons:
-Horrible new orientation
-No real training if you already have work experience. I was expected to "learn on the fly".
-Expensive medical benefits

review_title: Best place to learn experience while in nursing school
job_title: Patient Care Technician in Orlando, FL
pros: Learning opportunities, great workplace and management, helpful coworkers
cons: On call money and bonuses for coming in on OT should be giving to techs

job_title: Sponsored Projects Coordinator in Jacksonville, FL
pros: Its all about the kids. Nemours is very patient centered but also strives to make its employees happy.
cons: Because this organization is non profit, the pay is below average.

pros: Beautiful hospital. Most people there are friendly. Fair pay
cons: Not much opportunity for growth in some departments. Needs to hire more people to lighten workload. Needs improvements in many areas.

pros: Nemours Childrens Hospital is a great facility located in Orlando Fl great family centered hospital with new technology
cons: Have yet to determine any downfalls for working at Nemours

pros: Great children's hospital, innovative with technology and quality patient care,
